rm.serverAdmin

Class ServerAdmin

  • java.lang.Object
    • rm.serverAdmin.ServerAdmin

  • public class ServerAdmin
extends java.lang.Object
    ServerAdmin is used to administrate the servers of a cluster , e.g. under load balancing.

    The servers connectivity, i.e. the address (hostname), receive port, and send port, is specified in a configuration file, which is read only once directly after object creation. The default name of the configuration file is . Every line of the configuration file specifies one server of the cluster in the following syntax:

    <hostname> <receive port> <send port>

    See ServerConfig for the meaning of the parameters.

    The binding of a server using bind() returns the server's configuration and blocks the server for the usage by other objects, unless it is released through release(ServerConfig). That means, bind() does not return an already bound server, until this server is explicitly released through release(ServerConfig).

    From an object's perspective using this class, the object can exclusively use a server returned by bind(), unless the object releases this server through release(ServerConfig).

    The servers are returned round robin, if possible.

    The objects of this class are thread-safe.

    Hint: ServerAdmin does not realize the real communication between an object (client, load balancer, etc.) and the returned server. It does only handle the plain administration stuff.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Rainer Mueller
